robot_functions.name: move_joint
robot_functions.description: Moves a specified joint (head or arm) along a specific axis by a given degree. This is the low-level kinematic command. Positive degrees typically mean LEFT/UP/OUT; negative degrees mean RIGHT/DOWN/IN.

joint_name.description: The major body part the command applies to.

axis.description: The specific axis of rotation (e.g., YAW for side-to-side joint movement, PITCH for up-and-down joint movement, ELBOW for arm bending).

robot_functions.name: move_head
robot_functions.description: Moves a specified joint (head or arm) along a specific axis by a given degree. This is the low-level kinematic command. Positive degrees typically mean LEFT/UP/OUT; negative degrees mean RIGHT/DOWN/IN.

axis.description: The specific axis of rotation (e.g., YAW for side-to-side head movement, PITCH for up-and-down head movement, ELBOW for arm bending).

robot_functions.name: express_emotion
robot_functions.description: Activates complex or non-kinematic emotional/facial systems (e.g., LED color, sound, predefined short sequence like nodding).

emotion.description: The desired symbolic emotion or short, complex action.

robot_functions.name: say_text
robot_functions.description: Generates a spoken response. This should be used if the LLM cannot perform a physical action but needs to respond.

text.description: The exact text to be spoken.

robot_functions.name: report_error
robot_functions.description: Signals to the Behavior Manager that the user command is impossible, dangerous, or completely ambiguous.

reason.description: A brief explanation of why the command cannot be executed.
